page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT IN NEWBIGGIN HALL
page.content: We asked 100 children in our school questions about their{parents' {employment.}63 fathers and 60 mothers were in employment . 44 of the mothers we classed as being in part- time employment as they worked for less than 4 hours per day. These part-time jobs included cleaners (23) and dinner-ladies (8). 14 of the mothers in full-time employment were shop assistants. Only 8 of the fathers were employed in the manufacturing industries while the remainder were involved in service industries. 2 fathers were employed on oil rigs in the North Sea. Most of the fathers worked in jobs away from the estate,whereas most of the mothers worked within walking distance of their homes.
